## GENERAL CONDITIONS
(Applicable to the whole Policy)

### 1. Addition of Insured Person (Applicable to Annual Multi-Trip Policy Only)
No person added to any group in the Policy Schedule shall be covered under this Policy unless such person is specifically named as Insured Person and evidenced by a written endorsement to this Policy. Additional premium will be charged for each additional Insured Person included under this Policy after the commencement of the Period of Insurance or at the time of renewal of the Policy.
questions: How does the policy handle coverage for a person added to the Annual Multi-Trip Policy after the Period of Insurance has commenced, including premium adjustments and documentation requirements?
What are the conditions under which an additional insured person can be included in the Annual Multi-Trip Policy, and how must this inclusion be evidenced?
In the context of the Annual Multi-Trip Policy, how does the timing of adding an insured person (post-commencement versus at renewal) affect premium charges and coverage validity?
What documentation is required to prove that a newly added person is covered under the Annual Multi-Trip Policy, and how does this interact with the policy schedule?
How does the policy ensure that only persons specifically named and endorsed in writing are covered, and what are the implications if this procedure is not followed?
For an Annual Multi-Trip Policy, what are the financial implications of adding an insured person mid-term, and how does this affect the overall policy premium?

How does the policy define the process and conditions for adding insured persons to a group under the Annual Multi-Trip Policy, and what exclusions might apply if the process is not properly followed?
What is the significance of a written endorsement in adding an insured person to the Annual Multi-Trip Policy, and how does this endorsement affect the policy's legal enforceability?
How does the policy treat coverage for persons added to the group who are not specifically named or endorsed, and what general exclusions might apply in such cases?
In the event of adding multiple insured persons to the Annual Multi-Trip Policy after commencement, how are premiums calculated and what documentation must be maintained?
How does the policy address the scenario where an insured person is added without payment of the additional premium, and what are the consequences for coverage validity?
What are the procedural differences, if any, between adding an insured person at policy renewal versus during the active Period of Insurance under the Annual Multi-Trip Policy?
How does the addition of insured persons under the Annual Multi-Trip Policy interact with other general conditions or exclusions in the policy?
What are the implications for claims if an insured person was added to the Annual Multi-Trip Policy but the written endorsement was not properly issued or documented?
How does the policy ensure that the addition of insured persons complies with underwriting requirements, and what role does the written endorsement play in this process?
In the context of group coverage under the Annual Multi-Trip Policy, how does the policy schedule reflect changes when insured persons are added, and what is the importance of this reflection?
How does the policy handle disputes regarding coverage for persons purportedly added to the Annual Multi-Trip Policy without a formal written endorsement?
What are the limitations or restrictions on the number of insured persons that can be added to the Annual Multi-Trip Policy, and how does this affect premium calculations?
How does the policy address coverage for an insured person added after the Period of Insurance has expired or after the policy has been cancelled?
What is the relationship between the written endorsement requirement for adding insured persons and the policy's overall warranty or payment-before-cover conditions?
